website_summaries.verdict: The under-$1,000 Nikon D5200 is a capable D-SLR that delivers impressive image quality and continuous shooting at 4 frames per second, earning it our Editors' Choice.
cons: Will not autofocus with screw-drive lenses

customer_reviews.title: What a camera
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting into photography again and wanted a good DSLR, this camera is just awesome and there is so much help on the internet and plenty of books about this camera. I know the D5300 is just about to be released but I don't want the extra features it offers at my level of photography. This camera is very,very good for an amateur photographer it's two steps up from a point and shooter.
customer_reviews.author: MAB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera flipout screen is a must for Blog ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera flipout screen is a must for Blog and youtube! Handles a variety of functions really well recommend for beginners and enthusiasts!
customer_reviews.author: phillip lee

customer_reviews.title: only had a few days and just been messing around ...
customer_reviews.text: only had a few days and just been messing around at home with it....but very impressed....massive improvement on my D3100.....looking forward to getting out soon and trying it it properly.
customer_reviews.author: NpA2900

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera shame about Nikon admin
customer_reviews.text: Great value camera, with low noise at high iso. Huge resolution means you can heavily crop and still have a large print. However the £50 cashback did not go well. Nikon did not want to make the refund until I had sent the required documents several times. If I was charging for correspondence they would owed my another £50.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hales

customer_reviews.title: A great snapper
customer_reviews.text: Top class camera. really very pleased with the way it feels and handles. Looking forward to testing it fully.
customer_reviews.author: jem

customer_reviews.title: Great quality camera
customer_reviews.text: Great quality camera, read all the reviews on the internet
customer_reviews.author: Mr

customer_reviews.title: Neat.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent some time with a D7000, and also with a D5200, and out of the two I actually prefer the D5200. The cheaper camera is easy to use and well laid out. So I have given 5 stars for the D5200. Yip I like it allot.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great camera works fine but the battery it came with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera works fine but the battery it came with was for an older model so i had to buy my another one...
customer_reviews.author: mozz

customer_reviews.title: an upgrade from a D3100
customer_reviews.text: The wife needed an upgrade from her old D3100 so this seemed the way to go. She I very pleased with it but is still getting use to its many features.
customer_reviews.author: Mr keith packer

customer_reviews.title: first class camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Useful to be able to work remote from rear. Problem in focusing in dark areas the only drawback fro my point of view
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Smart DSLR with everything you need
customer_reviews.text: The camera is just perfect. It will suit all DSLR starter up to Pro. It was excellent picture quality and is still smart and portable. All you need to do is add good lens (as with every DSLR). Don't try to save money on lenses though. I purchased a macro and a tele lens for it. All I need.
customer_reviews.author: Bjorn Kohnen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a camera for a complete noob (myself) and with a little bit of training and tuition its very easy to use and gets you great results. Very happy and glad i joined the Nikon army and not Canon.
customer_reviews.author: PTC8

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Superb picture quality. Fantastic ease of use and flexibility. Needs more available on manual setting. D7100 better option if you are going to use on manual setting.
customer_reviews.author: C J Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: The camera is amazing. You do not need a costly DSLR to be honest. To start with this is amazing until one fine day you feel that you explored everything and there is something that this camera cannot deliver. Purchased Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 55-300mm f/4.5-5.6G ED VR Lens with this and its a deadly combination. Amazing delivery by Amazon is a topping on the cake. You guys rock!! Cheers!!
customer_reviews.author: Abhay Chaudhary

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: had Nikon D3200, but that one is really amazing! I did notice it works quicker , love the possibility to see myself while shooting because of its vari angle display!
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.text: I have a 3200, but found with two different lenses that whatever i wanted to take in the distance or near, by the time i had changed the lens the subject had "gone"so i bought this.
customer_reviews.author: GARRY MULLEN

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Had a Nikon D40X for my first DSLR then had a twirl with Canon....After having a Canon 7D I realised how heavy and bulky this was even though it was an excellent Camera so I returned to Nikon with the Brilliant D5200..Some will say a downgrade but not for me this is the dogs ............I recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent new camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought the body only as I have older D40 Nikon and some lenses which also work with D5200. Had previously considered D5100 but returned it last year as I was not pleased with using Live view - much better on this camera - Generally very fast AF, quiet and responsive. Takes excellent sharply focussed pictures using my 35mm 1.8 DX Nikon lens at present. Flash exposure very good Easily carried camera, long battery life, light weight , bright viewfinder very good clear LCD and just as was to use as my D40 which I am holding onto. Price has also dropped since I git mine by over £6=50 Unusually UK has D5200 before USA !
customer_reviews.author: iP4

customer_reviews.title: A natural upgrade for the DSLR enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade my Nikon D5000 fitted with the standard package 18 - 55mm lens and I was still considering the D5100 when the latest D5200 was launched. I also wanted to purchase the D5200 body only and select a different lens to more suit my general photography using only one lens. I finally settled on the well rated Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR Lens. I rounded off my order with a Hoya 67mm Pro-1 Digital UV Screw in Filter. Amazon supplied my order very promptly and I am delighted with my purchase. This combination gives me a chance to get maximum use of a great lens and versatile body.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Noshan

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera but I am very disappointed with it because I cannot open my Raw files, please could you tell me how to open them. Elsie Jenkins
customer_reviews.author: Elsie M Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5200 camera body - excellent in all respects.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera. Picture quality is amazing. Its light weight. Has swivel screen which is very useful for recording video. Camera body is compact. Controls are well placed. Battery life is more than sufficient. You could print huge prints because of very high resolution. Its quiet in operation. Very durable. I have been using this camera for more than a year now and have taken just over 5000 pictures. And I thoroughly enjoy using it. I have no negatives for this camera. its a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ahmad J. Zaigham

customer_reviews.title: D5200
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, had a d3000 and this is a great step up. More features, bigger censor and more megapixels. Slightly improved direct access to controls also.
customer_reviews.author: Alan
